column1: Losino-Petrovsky (Russian: Лоси́но-Петро́вский) is a town in Moscow Oblast
column3: located at the confluence of the Vorya and Klyazma Rivers 52 kilometers (32 mi) northeast of Moscow. Population: 22

column2: a manufacture for producing elk leather uniforms was established by Peter the Great. The sloboda around the manufacture was named Losinaya Petrovskaya (Лоси́ная Петро́вская). The manufacture existed until 1858
column3: by which time several other textile factories were established. In 1928
column4: the sloboda was granted urban-type settlement status

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as Losino-Petrovsky Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: Losino-Petrovsky Town Under Oblast Jurisdiction is incorporated as Losino-Petrovsky Urban Okrug.

Вступил в силу на следующий день после официального опубликования (13 января 2013 г.). Опубликован: "Ежедневные Новости. Подмосковье"
